back.definition: How to maintain critical operations durante disruption. Identifies critical processes, dependencies, workarounds. Goal: Keep business running.
back.example: Colonial Pipeline: BCP includes manual fuel delivery, communication plan. Tested? Probably not well. BCP needs quarterly testing.

back.definition: How to restore IT systems post-disaster. Backup/restore procedures, failover, rebuild steps. Subset of BCP focused on IT.
back.example: RTO (Recovery Time Objective): Max downtime tolerable. RPO (Recovery Point Objective): Max data loss tolerable. Colonial: RTO 6 days too long.

back.definition: 3 copies of data, 2 different media types, 1 offsite/offline. Protects against ransomware (air-gapped backup).
back.example: 3 copies: Production + Daily backup + Weekly archive. 2 media: Disk + Tape. 1 offsite: Cloud or physical vault. Test restores monthly.

back.definition: Test disaster recovery annually MINIMUM. Tabletop (discussion), Walkthrough (step-by-step), Full (actual failover). Identify gaps.
back.example: Colonial lesson: Restore from backups was slow. Indicates: backups not tested, restore procedures unclear. Testing reveals this.

unlock_content.title: Identify Priorities
points: Tier 1: Mission-critical (< 4 hour RTO). Ex: Payment processing, 911.
Tier 2: Important (< 24 hour RTO). Ex: Email, HR systems.
Tier 3: Standard (< 1 week RTO). Ex: Reporting, archives.
Dependencies: Database → App → Web. Must restore in order.
Colonial: Pipeline control = Tier 1. But took 6 days.
unlock_content.bonus_fact: BIA answers: If this system down, how long before business impact? That's your RTO.

unlock_content.title: Set Targets
points: RTO: Max downtime. Ex: 4 hours.
RPO: Max data loss. Ex: 1 hour (last backup).
Cost trade-off: Lower RTO/RPO = more expensive (real-time replication).
Document: Every critical system needs defined RTO/RPO.
Colonial: Actual recovery 6 days >> desired RTO.
unlock_content.bonus_fact: RTO=0, RPO=0 (zero downtime, zero data loss) = $$$$$. Active-active clusters, sync replication.

unlock_content.title: Implementation
points: Backup frequency: Matches RPO. RPO=1 hour = hourly backups.
Backup testing: Monthly restore tests. Verify integrity.
Air-gapped: Offline/immutable backups. Ransomware protection.
Cloud replication: AWS to Azure. Multi-cloud DR.
Veeam, Commvault, AWS Backup popular solutions.
unlock_content.bonus_fact: Ransomware targets backups. Immutable backups (write-once) = can't be encrypted.

unlock_content.title: Validation
points: Tabletop: Annual. Discuss scenario, walk through plan.
Simulation: Semi-annual. Partial failover, non-prod.
Full DR test: Annual. Actual failover to DR site. Production cutover.
Document gaps: Update plan based on test results.
Train staff: Everyone knows their role in DR.
unlock_content.bonus_fact: Untested DR plan = useless. Colonial learned hard way. Test, test, test.

options.text: RTO = max downtime tolerable. RPO = max data loss tolerable.
options.feedback: CORRECTO! RTO (Recovery Time Objective): How long can system be down? Ex: Payment system RTO=1 hour. Must restore within 1 hour. RPO (Recovery Point Objective): How much data loss acceptable? Ex: RPO=15 min means last 15 min of transactions might be lost. Need: Backup every 15 min. Trade-off: Lower RTO/RPO = more expensive (hot standby, real-time replication). Colonial: RTO should have been <1 day. Actual: 6 days.

options.text: RTO = tiempo de backup. RPO = frecuencia
options.feedback: Incorrecto. Confusión. RPO drives backup frequency pero RPO ≠ backup time.
